titleStmt.title: Partial Manuscripts Schema, constrained for usage in XForms
titleStmt.author: Pietro Liuzzo
Nathan Gibson
Maximilian de Molière

publicationStmt.authority: Institut für den Nahen und Mittleren Osten
publicationStmt.publisher: ERC-funded project: MAJLIS. The Transformation of Jewish Literature in Arabic in the Islamicate World

availability.licence: This file is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0.

revisionDesc.change: Created schema on basis of Arabic Manuscripts Schema created by Pietro Liuzzo

div.head: Information on this customization
div.p: Schema for MAJLIS Project. This part of the schema is used for entering descriptions of the manuscript additions using XForms.
Built on the Beta maṣāḥǝft Guidelines contain examples and details of that customization.
Added Rules from the consolidated schema of FIRHIST
Constrained this schema for generating forms.

moduleRef.include: desc item lb list p q title
additions locus locusGrp msDesc objectDesc origDate origPlace physDesc

valItem.desc: used for Single manuscript
used for Composite manuscript
used for Multiple Text Manuscript
used for the pricking of the layout
used for the ruling of the lines
Indicating that the book belongs to 1) an institution; 2) an individual.
note stating that the book has been purchased for money by an individual or an institution
Points only to the fact of the acquisition of the book or transaction with the book.
note written down as a receipt of a transaction of goods.
genealogy of local lineages or ruling families or individual rulers; it can be a genealogy of the owner/donor of the book, independent or included into another note.
The name of the scribe written down.
A short prayer for (the souls) of individuals.
note added at the end of the main text concerning its completion.
hymn or praise to God or other entities.
invocation against those who stole or erased the book or against other individuals.
Lists of books or other objects.
scribe’s note on commencing the work.
scribe’s note on ordering of the copying.
scribe’s note on commissioning of the writing.
scribe’s note on completing the writing.
scribe’s note on bequeathing.
text documenting an act of selling or buying something, in many cases a house and land, sometimes a book.
documentary record concerning the guarantors of a transaction or a loan.
generic note of a documentary, official character.
scribe’s entreat to God.
Content is too vague to assign another category or resists any interpretation.
Poem.
stamp affixed by the owning institution, e.g., a library.
Written message looking like a sample of the epistolary genre copied into a manuscript.
note added at a later stage in order to comment word or passages of the main text.
Addition of omitted passages, words or letters and the like.
Refers to a note aimed to solve a purely language difficulty.

moduleRef.except: addName affiliation age birth bloc climate country death district education event faith floruit forename genName geo geogFeat geogName langKnowledge langKnown listEvent listNym listObject listOrg listPerson listPlace listRelation location nameLink nationality nym object objectIdentifier objectName occupation offset org orgName persPronouns person personGrp persona place population region relation residence roleName settlement sex socecStatus state surname terrain trait
